solution_line_template: She has {num_dogs} dogs and it takes {minutes_per_dog} minutes to groom just 1 dog so it takes her {num_dogs}*{minutes_per_dog} = <<{num_dogs}*{minutes_per_dog}={minutes_per_day}>>{minutes_per_day} minutes per day to groom 2 dogs
In {num_days} days, she will have spent {num_days}*{minutes_per_day} = <<{num_days}*{minutes_per_day}={total_minutes_grooming}>>{total_minutes_grooming} minutes grooming her dogs

There are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in an hour so she spends {total_minutes_grooming}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_minutes_grooming}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_hours_grooming}>>{total_hours_grooming} hours grooming her dogs
